> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17934/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17934?src=pr&el=tree)

| [pandas/io/gbq.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17934?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2lvL2dicS5weQ==) | `25% <0%> (-58.34%)` | :arrow_down: |

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17934?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [5959ee3...a2680b9](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17934?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

> instead I would just defer to Index(values)

Unfortunately, this would work _only_ for all-NaN lists, since ``[3, np.nan]`` will result in a ``float64`` flat ``Index`` but in an ``int64`` level of ``MultiIndex``. Anyway...



> I would argue though that this should instead happen inside the Category

... I agree, done.

While I was at it I removed some obsolete warnings.
